sections.name: King Harral
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Lawful
traits.text: Lawful effects often manipulate energy from law-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to chaotic divine servants or divine servants of chaotic deities. A creature with this trait is lawful in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with void energy and soul-corrupting unholy magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by vitality energy and are healed by void energy, and don’t benefit from healing vitality effects.

sources.name: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City

link.name: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 42
link.alt: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 42

modifiers.name: +1 status to all saves vs. positive

universal_monster_ability.name: Negative Healing
universal_monster_ability.text: A creature with negative healing draws health from negative energy rather than positive energy. It is damaged by positive damage and is not healed by positive healing effects. It does not take negative damage, and it is healed by negative effects that heal undead.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

universal_monster_ability.name: Frightful Presence
universal_monster_ability.text: A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

universal_monster_ability.critical_success: The creature is unaffected by the presence.

automatic_abilities.name: Rejuvenation

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text:
This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to arcane magic.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

automatic_abilities.text: 24 hours after King Harral is destroyed, his body rebuilds itself on his throne (or, if the throne is destroyed, on the site where the throne once sat), similarly to how a lich's body is restored via its soul cage. If all of Saggorak's buildings are destroyed, or if heroes perform a great service in saving Saggorak (see Concluding the Adventure), King Harral loses this ability.

automatic_abilities.name: Counterspell
automatic_abilities.trigger: A creature casts a spell King Harral has prepared.
automatic_abilities.effect: The king expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. He can then attempt to dispel the triggering spell.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Shove
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Shove with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Shove using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

ability.name: Steady Spellcasting
ability.text: If another creature's reaction would disrupt King Harral's spell, he attempts a DC 15 flat check. If he succeeds, the spell isn't disrupted.
